channel.title: Programming Language(yep, another one)
channel.description:
I know allot of people have asked what the best programming language is to start with but i still dont know :confused:
anyway i do have some experience in programming but not that much so what is the best programming language to begin with if you want to be a good programmer? and what programming language is the best to learn AFTER you learned the beginning programming language? ======>
1)Best beginning programming language?=.... 2)Best programming language after you learned beginning language?=.... 3)Best "hacking" programming language?=...
Please answer these 3 questions above :o these are the most "learn to program" questions i've seen on lots of forums...
so if i get lots of good reply's il try to make a tut out of it so nobody has to ask these questions again ;D

item.title: Programming Language(yep, another one)
item.dc:creator: @Scar Scar
item.description:
@Scar wrote:

ok i have come to my decision(yes,i know it took me a long time to decide)
I’ve chosen for Scar.
thanks to everyone who helped me

EDIT: here are some scripts i made
This one right-clicks on your mozilla icon(dont know how to double-click yet )

ClickMouse(x+5,y+5,false);

end.[/scar]

And here’s another useless script:
[scar]program New;

const User = ‘Spitfire696’;//Fill in your Username
Pass = ‘I’‘m not telling’;//Fill in your Password

  //Do not touch!!

procedure Username;
begin
Writeln (’--------------------’);
Writeln ('Username = '+User);
Writeln (‘Password = ‘+Pass);
Writeln (’--------------------’);
end;

begin
Username;
end.[/scar]

And another one…

[scar]program New;
var
frmDesign : TForm;
Panel1 : TPanel;
lol : TEdit;
Button1 : TButton;
Panel2 : TPanel;
loll : TEdit;
User, Pass: string;

procedure ButtonClick(Sender: TObject);
begin
User:=lol.Text;
Pass:=loll.Text;
end;

procedure InitForm;
begin
frmDesign := CreateForm;
frmDesign.Left := 265;
frmDesign.Top := 117;
frmDesign.Width := 245;
frmDesign.Height := 205;
frmDesign.Caption := ‘frmDesign’;
frmDesign.Color := clBtnFace;
frmDesign.Font.Color := clWindowText;
frmDesign.Font.Height := -11;
frmDesign.Font.Name := ‘MS Sans Serif’;
frmDesign.Font.Style := [];
frmDesign.Visible := False;
frmDesign.PixelsPerInch := 96;
Panel1 := TPanel.Create(frmDesign);
Panel1.Parent := frmDesign;
Panel1.Left := 25;
Panel1.Top := 9;
Panel1.Width := 185;
Panel1.Height := 41;
Panel1.Alignment := taLeftJustify;
Panel1.Caption := ‘Username’;
Panel1.TabOrder := 0;
lol := TEdit.Create(Panel1);
lol.Parent := Panel1;
lol.Left := 55;
lol.Top := 9;
lol.Width := 121;
lol.Height := 21;
lol.TabOrder := 0;
lol.Text := ‘lol’;
Button1 := TButton.Create(frmDesign);
Button1.Parent := frmDesign;
Button1.Left := 76;
Button1.Top := 131;
Button1.Width := 75;
Button1.Height := 25;
Button1.Caption := ‘Start’;
Button1.TabOrder := 1;
Panel2 := TPanel.Create(frmDesign);
Panel2.Parent := frmDesign;
Panel2.Left := 27;
Panel2.Top := 65;
Panel2.Width := 185;
Panel2.Height := 41;
Panel2.Alignment := taLeftJustify;
Panel2.Caption := ‘Password’;
Panel2.TabOrder := 2;
loll := TEdit.Create(Panel2);
loll.Parent := Panel2;
loll.Left := 52;
loll.Top := 11;
loll.Width := 121;
loll.Height := 21;
loll.TabOrder := 0;
loll.Text := ‘loll’;
end;

procedure SafeInitForm;
var
v: TVariantArray;
begin
setarraylength(V, 0);
ThreadSafeCall(‘InitForm’, v);
end;

procedure ShowFormModal;
begin
frmDesign.ShowModal;
end;

procedure SafeShowFormModal;
var
v: TVariantArray;
begin
setarraylength(V, 0);
ThreadSafeCall(‘ShowFormModal’, v);
end;

begin
SafeInitForm;
SafeShowFormModal;
end.
[/scar]

post some positive/negative feedback :o

(All made by me,Scar)

Read full topic

item.description:

[quote=“googlethis, post:29, topic:15745”][quote author=lordslayer565 link=topic=23512.msg389201#msg389201 date=1162523951]
1)Best beginning programming language?=Html,kpl depends on how old you are lol
2)Best programming language after you learned beginning language?=Vb
3)Best “hacking” programming language?=I dont know that much about hacking

[/quote]
HTML isn’t really a language.[/quote]

What do you think the “L” stands for?

As crappy as html is, it’s kind of an essential to learn at one point or another. Learning some of the basic tags is a useful “skill.” Just a crappy skill.

item.title: Programming Language(yep, another one)
item.dc:creator: @goatee goatee
item.description:
@goatee wrote:

[quote=“BobDole81, post:9, topic:15745”][quote author=frank_ link=topic=23512.msg265944#msg265944 date=1158999681]
Well you all, except iwasinmoparseas101class …and google…, show your ignorance for what hacking really is.
[/quote]Yes, pls. Hacking is not cracking guys…

  1. Depends, if you’re dedicated, go for c++…if you want something simpler first, go for java.
  2. There’s a lot you can still do with java…its not just a beginning language, but c++ has much more flexibility if you want to do more in depth work.
  3. Hacking can mean various things…so depends on what type.

Never heard of KPL either…looks pretty cool. I remember the first “programming language” I learned was a LOGO based language in school in about 3rd or 4th grade…that turtle was so cool :P[/quote]

He he i had that turtle one too… i only ever managed to make it spin… i thought i was an uber programmer! I was scream at my teacher shouting “omg looks what i did its amazing” … 5 years later and i slap myself at my complete … well gayness!

Read full topic

item.title: Programming Language(yep, another one)
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

Since I only know 1 language, I’ll tell you why you should atleast look into learning it.

SCAR. Not good at alot of things, but it’s simple. You can make games in it, use it as an automation program, and that’s about it. As a beginner in scar, it will probally suit all your needs. If your not very educated at what things on your pc do, then scar is probally best for you. It’s simple. Some may argue about this, but it’s powerful. Yes, it’s buggy, but it does what it says on the tin. You can make advanced functions and procedures from the basic functions/procedures. It gives you a good idea on what most languages will be like. Not hard to learn, all you need to learn is how to make it do what you want! That’s it!

I think SCAR is the best beginner program. You will learn a good lesson, what to expect in more advanced languages. To be honest, I see scar on a whole as a program, not a language. For a script, you just slap a few procedures and functions here and there, and decide what order they will be preformed in and it’s done. But that’s not being honest.

The way I see it, you tell scar what to do and it does it. I don’t see this with “proper” languages. But overall, SCAR boils down to an automation program. You can tell it to display canvas here, and move them from user input or not.

Read full topic

item.title: Programming Language(yep, another one)
item.dc:creator: @BobDole81 BobDole81
item.description:
@BobDole81 wrote:

Depends what company Companies offering web services will need php/asp/jsp coders, others providing enterprise software will probably want C++ coders. If you want a job with jagex you’ll probably need C++ as well as java. If you want to work for an engineering company, you’d better learn access and VB

Stick to something simple though if you’re just beginning…it takes time to get comfortable with a new language, let alone master it

Read full topic

item.title: Programming Language(yep, another one)
item.dc:creator: @BobDole81 BobDole81
item.description:
@BobDole81 wrote:

[quote=“frank_, post:5, topic:15745”]Well you all, except iwasinmoparseas101class …and google…, show your ignorance for what hacking really is.[/quote]Yes, pls. Hacking is not cracking guys…

  1. Depends, if you’re dedicated, go for c++…if you want something simpler first, go for java.
  2. There’s a lot you can still do with java…its not just a beginning language, but c++ has much more flexibility if you want to do more in depth work.
  3. Hacking can mean various things…so depends on what type.

Never heard of KPL either…looks pretty cool. I remember the first “programming language” I learned was a LOGO based language in school in about 3rd or 4th grade…that turtle was so cool

Read full topic
